    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageAnswerChoice

        public ImageAnswerChoice()
        Default constructor. Creates unlocked default com.vasolsim.common.file.AnswerChoice with a null image.

      • ImageAnswerChoice

        public ImageAnswerChoice(@Nullable
                         java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Default constructor. Creates unlocked default com.vasolsim.common.file.AnswerChoice with a given image.
        Parameters:
        image - the image

      • ImageAnswerChoice

        public ImageAnswerChoice(@Nullable
                         java.lang.String visibleChoiceID,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String text,
                         boolean isActive,
                         boolean isCorrect,
                         @Nullable
                         java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Advanced constructor. Creates unlocked com.vasolsim.common.file.AnswerChoice with a given image.
        Parameters:
        visibleChoiceID - this is the string that will identify the answer choice. ID's will remain in order even if the answer choices are scrambled. (e.g. ABC will still be ABC)
        text, - this is the text of the answer
        isActive - denotes if the answer active. Only active answers will be written to the final exam file. For example, if a multiple choice question consists of 6 out of 8 answers, then there will be two inactive answers.
        isCorrect - denotes if the answer is correct
        image - the image

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        @Nullable
public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        gets the image attached to the question
        Returns:
        the image

      • setImage

        public final boolean setImage(@Nullable
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        sets the image attached to the question, only if the question is unlocked. Will re-render the buffered image to JavaFX image as well; if the image is large, you may need to handle this operation in a thread.
        Parameters:
        image - the image

public javafx.scene.image.Image getFxImage()
